reviews.sentence: Very good service but tired hotel. The lobby of this hotel is lovely but the rooms not so much. My room a Hilton Honors romwas clean but could really use some fresh painting and carpet cleaning. It looked extremely tired. However the service was great valet parking and front lobby. I would avoid the restaurant. When I went in for dinner the Manager could not even find me a server. The food was just OK. If you have the option go out. There are loads of nice places in all price ranges very close.
A little getaway. Wonderful room friendly staff free parking Beautiful grounds.
nice and clean large room ample parking good areanothing.

Very nice. I have stayed in a lot of Hiltons and I was not disappointed. The hotel staff was very accommodating. We were there for business. So there was no sleeping in. But when I tell you room serve was the fastest i ve ever had it was super fast. It was like as soon as it was off the griddle it was in our room. One thing I did not like was parking. It was a AKA cluster event going on and it was a lot more people there than regular guest. It would have been helpful if the staff would have informed that their were events going on in the hotel that weekend so we would have been better prepared to walk a distance in the parking lot. I also ate in the restaurant had the catfish poboy. Man oh man that was a really good poboy. If you happen to stay there try it. It was not on the room service menu but if you go to the restaurant it will be there. Other than the parking the hotel was great. It was clean. Housekeeping cleaned like they were suppose to. It was some fragrance they sprayed in the room I forgot to ask about that smelled really good and I would have liked it for my home.

Hilton Memphis. The Hilton Memphis is perfectly situated in Midtown. minutes from all things to do and see be it downtown midtown or on the east side. The facility has lovely grounds quiet surroundings ample parking and a wonderful staff. The Hilton is our place to stay when we come to the city every time.

If you are into the location it is a really great place. Hotel is very clean and beautiful. Very comfort and high quality. Right off the highway but very quiet. Lots of free parking space. did not have breakfast or used any facilities but the bar does offer Swetwater IPA which is a great beer. Definitely used the bar. Oh and WIFI was as good as they get. I got a deal at 100 a night does not get any better than this for that price. Location for me was not great but all other hotels were full. If you are into Germantown and East Memphis it is perfect.

Great Hotel Staff. Incredibly friendly staff. Candy in the executive lounge was great. Only 2 elevators work which is annoying but surviveable. Whatch out if you use the stairs as many does to certain floors are locked from the stairwell side. My room on the top floor did not have a fridge but I heard other rooms did if you need that be sure to ask. Free parking is nice. 2 Crosfit gyms nearby is nice. Great stay.

Good overnight stay. I spent less time here than I planned but the stay was nice. It was my first experience with the digital key which was kinda nice to not have one more thing to carry around. The staff was very nice whenever I had occasion to interact with them. I got a high floor and seemed to hit every for on my way down to check out in the morning as there appeared to be a football team staying there. but it was a great view and a nice property. It soared to be an older property based on the design but it was well updated and very comfortable. The room was well appointed and roomy with surprisingly high water pressure in the shower for being on the 23rd floor. The cafe had a good selection for breakfast and there was plenty of parking in what felt like a secure and safe area. I travel quite often and this location will be my go to spot when I visit Memphis.
Loved the dining amineties free parking and the quality of the room well appointed and quiet. Location was perfect for my visit.

Perfect all around. Plenty of space for parking and the hotel amenities was more than enough. The location could nt be in a better and safer atmosphere. I will definitely be returning to this hotel in the near future and recommending it to family and friends.

would not go there again. Hotel beautiful inside. Parking free but far away from entrance. Check in took a long time though there was only one person ahead of me in line. No acknowledgement as I approached the desk. no courtesies.

There were what appeared to be prostitution in this area and hotel. Was not a safe area to stay. Even the signs said the hotel was not responsible for broken in vehicles. It was a very long walk from parking lot to hotel. Will not stay or recommend this place.

Stay Away. This hotel has to do something about the security of its property. They obviously know they have a problem because there are signs everywhere about warning about Parking At Your Own Risk. I do not expect to stay at a Hilton and have my vehicle vandalized which is what happened during my stay. They have to make some changes such as 247 parking lot security to keep their guests personal property safe. This happened to 4 different vehicles the night of my stay. The Polices comment was Well this has not happened since May. So I guess 6 weeks without a problem is good in Memphis. Bottom Line decent hotel but do not stay there if you must bring a vehicle.

This is not a safe location and nobody really gives a flip. Take the caution signs in the parking lot seriously. There are a lot of car break ins. it is so common staff do not even look up at you when you mention it. Broke window out of my vehicle pried open the door with a crowbar and ransacked the inside. Never heard a peep from management such as is there anything we can help with. We really are sorry we do our best. After a rather tense conversation with a desk superior he finally managed to provide limo service to the repair shop to pick up my vehicle at no cost. The food is worse than airline and priced through the roof. Here for a conference and conference staff were mostly inept and unconcerned. Had guards at meeting room due to expensive antiques on display. Guards nodded off and paid no attention to people coming and going. Can only imagine overnight coverage. Rooms are small and outdated but clean enough to be acceptable. I can not wait to get out of here. Would leave early but the will not refund my money for the night. Unbelievable. Be careful be cautious bring your own food. Only positive thing I saw over a week stay was helpful and kind bell staff. Hilton should be ashamed.

Not so good. Rooms are tired with outdated furniture although the mattress was comfortable. The furniture was too large for the room. The carpet was old. Noise from other rooms could be heard throughout the night. At six am An alarm clock went off in someones room and rang for 2o minutes. The lobby was beyond its prime with cheesy outdated look. The neighborhood is not safe and the parking lot is patrolled by police.

Damp humid rooms. Rooms are all in a tower this was not a bad thing but the tower and rooms have poor air circulation. You take a shower and the hotel rooms glass fogs and condensates leaving dripping windows and puddles at the base of the windows making for dampness in the room so you turn on the AC to help circulate the air then the heater to dry up. its a mess. Also its a long walk from the parking lot to the hotel entrance if you do not arrive early. spots are limited.

A Good Hilton. An older but we will maintained Hilton. I thought the fitness center and rooms were well done and clean. The executive lounge was okay and breakfast was above par. Free parking is a win too. My only issue with this property is the WiFi. It consistently disconnects and then disappears returning as a connection 5 10 minutes later. This makes it awfully hard to do anything productive.
Wo n’t be back. Staff and security were nice. Vehicle got broken in to along with 4 others.

The Hilton is not what it used to be. Not worth the price. The bed and desk part of room was nice. The bath and vanity area was dark and outdated. The staff at the check Precious was the name was rude. When I called front desk for help she put me on hold. Parking was horrible due to a booked fundraiser. When I asked Precious about the parking she lied and said the hotel was booked to capacity. Two other employees told me about the fundraiser. All room quests were forced to walk a long distance to check in. I did not like the bar area and massive lobby. People were eating fast food take out at all the couch table areas. It is in a huge space with kids running about. I waited for three employees to finish petting a dog before I could check out. Felt the staff was extremely unprofessional. I thought Hilton Hotels were better than this.

Clean. Park at Your Own Risk. The location was pretty good proximity to everything we wanted to do. Check in was pleasant but not informative. I was not given any information about my breakfast that was apparently included with my stay or the location of where to find said breakfast. Hotel was clean and up to date. Multiple vehicles were broken into the first night we were there which appeared to be a common occurrence. Might want to think about adding patrol or staying in a hotel that does that already.
